message: If I have Android app apk file How can I know if he native app or web-based (cross platform app) how can I confirm that ?

data.message: I think you can extract the apk content.
Revere engineering, try this web site http://www.decompileandroid.com/
Most probably if it's cross platform you'll find the web based files in assets folder. It is better to decompile the apk and check it

Hello anas
you can reverse it easily  also most of cross platforms has an HTML and js Inside it after extracting the aAPK
also you can know it from the quality !

Very easy in most cases ...
Web-based normally use web browser, it is easy to find the popular rotating loading animation in center of the screen, web fonts or web-pages, web-rendering to the page, web controls ( drop-down etc ), Web Apps normally doesn't have this smooth animation the native have and even if they did, you will experience some delay and flickers.

Native apps, are always faster, their chrome controls are a little unique, not all of them can be done easily in web-apps, native animations are too smooth without flickers or glitches, response time is even faster, .
if it's E-commerce app, it's good to be web-based or native ?

this main folder and files in apk file after extract it 

assets
meta-inf
res
androidmainfest.xml
classes.dex
resources.arsc

you can know it easily without extracting. without tools . just one trick: go to device settings -> developer options -> show layout boundries.  if it is native, there will be boxes on every view. if it is web, there will be one big box on webview. waiting a chocolate for this trick :)

the easy way, you can just uncompress the apk with winrar or winzip or anything, 
-- If it's builded with Cordova you will find inside the uncompressed folder a folder named "assets"
inside it you will find folder named "www"
inside that folder you will see all the html/css/js/assets of the app
If you couldn't distinguish from the feeling of using the app, then they did a good job
